org.platanios.learn.optimization

Class ConjugateGradientSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.optimization.AbstractIterativeSolver
      • org.platanios.learn.optimization.ConjugateGradientSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Solver

    public final class ConjugateGradientSolver
extends AbstractIterativeSolver
    Matrix \(A\) in this case needs to be symmetric and positive definite. If it is not, then the solver may be able to transform the problem in a way such that the final matrix being used is positive definite. The enumeration ConjugateGradientSolver.ProblemConversionMethod contains the currently supported methods to do that. However, none of this methods will work is \(A\) has at least one zero eigenvalue. The biconjugate gradient does not have that requirement about matrix \(A\).
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  ConjugateGradientSolver.AbstractBuilder<T extends ConjugateGradientSolver.AbstractBuilder<T>> 
      static class  ConjugateGradientSolver.Builder 
      static class  ConjugateGradientSolver.PreconditioningMethod 
      static class  ConjugateGradientSolver.ProblemConversionMethod
      Enumeration of supported methods for converting a non symmetric or non positive definite problem into a symmetric positive definite problem, for solving it using the conjugate gradient solver.
